TestDescription.name: WordPress default administrator account
TestDescription.Description: By default WordPress creates an administrator user account named [dark][bold]admin[/bold][/dark]. Using the default Admin WordPress Account, hackers can easily launch a brute force attack against it. In order to help deter this type of attack, you should change your default WordPress administrator username to something more difficult to guess.
TestDescription.Impact: No impact is associated with this vulnerability.
TestDescription.Recommendation: Change the default WordPress administrator username to something more difficult to guess. Consult web references for more information.
